meanings.sent1: I need to unlink the chains to set the swing free.
meanings.sent2: Please unlink the power cord before attempting to repair the device.
meanings.sent3: Trying to unlink my shoelaces while hopping on one foot was quite a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to unlink the two rings, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent5: The key to escaping the handcuffs was to unlink the metal chain with precision.

meanings.definition: To remove a link or connection
meanings.sent1: She had to unlink the photos from the email before sending it.
meanings.sent2: It is important to unlink personal accounts from shared devices.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally tried to unlink my headphones from the music player while still wearing them.
meanings.sent4: The detective was able to unlink the suspect from the crime scene with solid evidence.
meanings.sent5: The goal was to unlink the old website from the new one seamlessly.

meanings.definition: To break a connection or association
meanings.sent1: The therapist helped him unlink negative thoughts from past experiences.
meanings.sent2: It can be challenging to unlink emotions from certain memories.
meanings.sent3: She tried to unlink her name from the embarrassing incident at the party.
meanings.sent4: The artist wanted to unlink his work from any political affiliations.
meanings.sent5: The goal was to unlink the company's image from the recent scandal.
